# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.ifj.org/es/actions/projects/africa/informa-formation-sur-les-phenomenes-migratoires-en-afrique-de-louest?tx_news_pi1%5Baction%5D=detail&tx_news_pi1%5Bcontroller%5D=News&tx_news_pi1%5Bnews%5D=21667&tx_news_pi1%5BoverwriteDemand%5D%5Bcategories%5D=47&cHash=7448603e6b0fa12844a83484b8707019): 
Content: "Aludaini was the founder of the [October 16th Media Group](https://16october.com/about-us/#:~:text=The%20Gaza-based%2016th%20October%20Group%20is%20a%20group%20of)
 and worked there as a senior journalist.  

On 28 August, journalist **Mohammad Abed Rabbo** of Al-Manara Media Production Company was killed in an Israeli airstrike that hit his apartment in central Gaza.

On 26 August, PJS [reported](https://pjs.ps/ar/page-3180.html)
 the death of 39-year-old journalist **Ali Taima**, a cameraman for Al-Awda TV channel, who was killed in an Israeli airstrike in the Mawasi area of Khan Younis.

On 22 August, Al Quds TV photojournalist **Hossam Manal Al-Dabbaka** was killed with his wife, children and other family members when their apartment was hit by an Israeli strike in the Al-Maghazi refugee camp in central Gaza, [media](https://en.royanews.tv/news/53700)
 reported. 

On 20 August, journalist **Hamza Murtaja** was killed in an Israeli airstrike that hit Mustafa Hafez School, in western Gaza City, [PJS](https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=542629458098259&set=a.211639694530572)
 reported. 

On 18 August, freelance photojournalist **Ibrahim Muhareb**, who worked for a number of media, was killed due to Israeli gunfire and shelling in western Khan Yunis when the Israeli tanks entered the city in southern Gaza, [PJS](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=541821901512348&set=a.211639694530572)
 and [media](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/8/19/israels-war-on-gaza-live-israeli-forces-invade-khan-younis-deir-el-balah)
 reported.

On 9 August, journalist **Tamim Muammar**, who worked for the Palestinian Broadcasting Corporation - Voice of Palestine, and journalist **Abdullah Al-Sousi**, who worked for Al Aqsa TV, were killed in two different Israeli airstrikes in Khan Yunis, southern of the Gaza Strip, [PJS](https://www.pjs.ps/ar/page-3170.html?fbclid=IwY2xjawEms2lleHRuA2FlbQIxMAABHdcaJwFHyAMhGJ_fzWPyWry4VJPS0kQZOtag2WKRHZjvsMaflzRboOG4hA_aem_FLFZJwiysq4zATuXeJa-PQ)
 and [media](https://www.newarab.com/news/gaza-journalist-tamim-muammar-killed-israeli-air-strike)
 reported. 

On 6 August, **Mohammed Issa Abu Saada**, freelance photographer and videographer who worked for several media including local outlet Sahat and Al-Sharqiya, [was killed](https://www.unesco.org/en/articles/unesco-director-general-deplores-death-journalist-mohammed-issa-abu-saada-palestine)
 in an Israeli airstrike that in Al-Zana neighbourhood of Khan Yunis, southern Gaza. 

On 31 July, journalist **Ismail al-Ghoul** and cameraman **Rami al-Refee**, who worked for Al Jazeera Arabic, [were killed](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/31/al-jazeera-journalist-cameraman-killed-in-gaza-attack#:~:text=Al%20Jazeera%20Arabic%20journalist%20Ismail%20al%2DGhoul%20and%20his%20cameraman,City%2C%20according%20to%20initial%20information)
 in an Israeli air attack in Shati refugee camp, west of Gaza City, PJS [reported](https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=530398275988044&set=a.211639694530572)
.

On 29 July, the PJS [reported](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=529166332777905&set=a.211639701197238)
 the killing of journalist of **Mohammad Majid Abu Daqa** in an Israeli strike in Khan Yunis, southern of the Gaza Strip. 

On 20 July, **Mohamed Abu Jasser,** journalist who worked for newspapers Al-Risala and Felesteen, was killed in an Israeli airstrike in Jabalia refugee camp, northern Gaza.

On 15 July, **Mohammad Meshmesh,** director of programms at Al Aqsa Voice radio, was killed in an Israeli bombing on the Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza. 

On 13 July, journalist **Mohammad Manhal Abu Armanah,** was killed in an Israeli strike that hit tents of displaced people in Khan Yunis, southern of the Gaza Strip, Al Mayadeen [reported](https://www.almayadeen.net/latestnews/2024/7/13/%D9%81%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%B7%D9%8A%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%AD%D8%AA%D9%84%D8%A9--%D9%85%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%B3%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D9%8A%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%8A%D9%86--%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%B4%D9%87%D8%A7%D8%AF-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%81%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%AD%D9%85%D8%AF-%D9%85%D9%86%D9%87%D9%84-%D8%A3%D8%A8)
. 

On 6 July, the couple formed by Palestine Now news agency correspondent, **Amjad Al-Jahjouh,** and programme producer and presenter at the Islamic University radio station, **Wafa Abu Dabaan**, were killed in an Israeli strike in the Nuseirat refugee camp in the middle of the Gaza Strip. On the same day, journalist **Salma Mukhaimar** was killed in an air strike in Rafah, southern Gaza Strip, PJS [reported](https://www.facebook.com/PALESTINIANJOURNALISTSSYNDICATE/posts/pfbid02bn2UML8XjSUg961v2TNvU1dBc8L5UPFfg72MzunnAGbio63ZAYeFY25SLbjEyYQxl)
.

On the same day, journalist **Zaher Al Afghani**, who worked for Mithaq Media Network, was killed when an airstrike hit his home in Deir Al Balah.

On 24 October, **Tasneem Bkheet,** a journalist for Al-Saada magazine, was killed along with several family members in Yarmouk, west of Gaza City.  

On 23 October, Palestinian news agency WAFA and PJS [confirmed](https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/138587)
 the death of journalist **Mohammed Imad Labad**, who worked for Al Resalah news website, following an Israeli bombing close to his house in Sheikh Radwan neighbourhood in Gaza city. 

On 22 October, **Roshdi Sarraj**, co-founder of Ain Media, photojournalist, film-maker and fixer for several international media, including Radio France, was killed in an Israeli air raid that hit his home, western Gaza city, [PJS](https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=369979938696546&set=a.211639694530572)
 and [media](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/10/21/israel-gaza-war-hamas-and-israel-spar-over-hostage-release)
 reported.

On 21 October, **Hani Madhoun**, who worked as an administrative staff for Al Aqsa TV, was killed in an Israeli airstrike on his home in Gaza. 

On 20 October, PJS [confirmed](https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=368799695481237&set=a.211639701197238)
 the death of **Muhammad Abu Ali**, a journalist with Al-Shabab radio in Gaza, who was killed by Israeli shelling of his home in the northern Gaza strip.

On 19 October, **Khalil Abu Athra**, cameraman for Al-Aqsa TV, [was killed](https://www.almayadeen.net/latestnews/2023/10/19/%D9%81%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%B7%D9%8A%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%AD%D8%AA%D9%84%D8%A9--%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%AA%D9%82%D8%A7%D8%A1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B2%D9%85%D9%8A%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%81%D9%8A-%D8%AE%D9%84%D9%8A%D9%84-%D8%A3%D8%A8%D9%88-%D8%B9%D8%A7%D8%B0%D8%B1%D8%A9-%D9%85%D8%B5%D9%88%D8%B1-%D9%81%D8%B6)
 in the Al-Nasr neighborhood, north of Rafah.

On 18 October Al-Aqsa TV producer and director **Samih Al-Nadi** [was killed](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=367985045562702&set=a.211639701197238)
 in an aircraft bombing on the Gaza Strip. 

On the same day, **Abdel Rahman al-Tanani**, freelance journalist and social media publisher for Zaman FM, was killed when an Israeli airstrike hit his father's home in Jabalia refugee camp, in northern Gaza. Her body was recovered from the rubber three days later.

On 8 October, freelance journalist **Asaad Shamlakh** was killed with his family in an Israeli airstrike on his home in Sheikh Ejline neighborhood in Gaza city, PJS and [BBC Arabic](https://www.bbc.com/arabic/articles/cmlrvengk39o)
 confirmed. 

On 7 October, Palestinian photojournalist **Mohammad Al-Salhi**, working for news agency Fourth Authority was shot dead while covering the military operations at the border east of Palestinian refugee camp Al-Bureij, located in the central Gaza Strip, according to the state-run news agency [WAFA](https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/137963)
.

**Ibrahim Lafi** from Ain Media news agency was killed while reporting near Beit Hanoun checkpoint, close to the separation fence with Israel, in the northern Gaza Strip, the media [reported](https://www.reddit.com/r/Palestine/comments/172akg8/gazan_journalist_yara_eid_reacts_to_news_that_her/)
. 

On the same day, journalist **Mohammad Jarghoun**, working for Smart Media, a media production company in Gaza, was killed while covering the fight between Hamas and the Israeli army, close to Rafah, in the southern Gaza Strip.

, Marwa's family lost contact with her on 5 July following an Israeli airstrike that hit a nearby house. 

On 11 August, freelance photojournalist **Mohammed Al-Khaldi** succumbed to his wounds sustained as a result of the Israeli airstrike that targeted a tent housing Al Jazeera journalists, medics at Al Shifa Hospital [reported](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israel-strike-kills-al-jazeera-journalists-gaza-2025-08-11/)
. 

On 10 August, Israeli forces killed five Al Jazeera staff including journalist **Anas al-Sharif**, correspondent **Mohammed Qreiqeh**, camera operators **Ibrahim Zaher** and **Moamen Aliwa**, and driver **Mohammed Noufal** in a targeted attack on a tent housing journalists located outside Al Shifa Hospital in Gaza City

On 30 July, the PJS reported the killing of photojournalist and PJS member **Ibrahim Mahmoud Hajaj** as a result of Israeli shelling in the Al-Daraj neighbourhood in Gaza City.

 journalist **Adam Abu Harbid** along with his family in the Yarmouk area in central Gaza City.

On 23 July, an Israeli airstrike killed journalist **Walaa Al Jabari** along with her entire family in Gaza City. . 

Journalist **Ahmed Qaljah** succumbed to his injuries on 5 June after being critically wounded in an Israeli attack that targeted a group of journalists at Al Ahli Hospital in Gaza City, [reported](https://www.pjs.ps/ar/index.html)
 the PJS. 

On 9 June, freelance photographer **Moamen Abu Al-Ouf**, [was killed](https://www.unesco.org/en/articles/unesco-director-general-condemns-killing-journalist-moamen-abu-alouf-palestine)
 by Israeli artillery fired from a tank in the Al-Tuffah neighourhood in Gaza City, while reporting.

On 5 June, the PJS [confirmed](https://www.pjs.ps/ar/page-3342.html)
 the killing of **Suleiman Hajjaj**, a correspondent for Palestine Today; **Ismail Badah**, a cameraman for Palestine Today; and **Samir Al-Rifai** from Shams News Agency. On the same day, Al Ghad TV channel [reported](https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=1055702893264435&set=a.607681404733255)
 the killing of journalist **Ahmed Hesham Abu Al-Rous** in an Israeli airstrike in the Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza. On the same day, media director of Al Quds TV, **Mohammad Al Sakni**, was killed when a strike hit his home in Al-Tuffah neighbourhood, east of Gaza City, PJS reported. 

On 1 July, editor-in-chief of local news agency Shams, **Mohammad Abu Sharia**, succumbed to his injuries sustained from an Israeli missile launched near the journalist's home in Gaza City. 

On 6 June, freelance journalist **Rasheed Albably** was killed in an Israeli airstrike in the Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza.

On 31 May, journalist and presenter of local radio Watan, **Ola al-Dahdouh,** was killed in an Israeli bombing of her home on Al-Jalaa Street in central Gaza City, PJS [reported](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=494574892903716&set=a.211639694530572)
. 

On 17 May, photojournalist working for the local Palestine Post Network, **Mahmoud Jahjouh,** was killed along with his family in an Israeli airstrike that hit his home in Sheikh Radwan neighbourhood in Gaza city, according to PJS, the [Palestine Post Network](https://ppost.ps/post/8519/%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%B4%D9%87%D8%A7%D8%AF-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B2%D9%85%D9%8A%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D8%AD%D9%81%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%AD%D9%85%D9%88%D8%AF-%D8%AC%D8%AD)

[reported](https://www.flickr.com/photos/44415851@N02/4286908427)
.

[media](https://www.maannews.net/news/2117148.html)
.

.

On 29 April, **Salem Abu Toyour**, media worker at Al Quds Al Youm channel, was killed in an Israeli airstrike that hit his home in Nuseriat camp, central Gaza. 

On 26 April, freelance photojournalists **Ibrahim Al-Gharbawi** and **Ayman Al-Gharbawi** were killed in an Israeli drone strike in the Hamad neighbourhood in Khan Yunis, southern Gaza. 

On 25 April, **Mohammed Basam Al Jamal**, who worked as a correspondent for Palestine Now news agency, succumbed to his injuries following an Israeli airstrike that hit his home in Al-Jenenah neighbourhood in Rafah, in southern Gaza, [PJS](https://www.pjs.ps/?p=3103)
 and [media](https://www.skeyesmedia.org/ar/News/News/26-04-2024/11581)

On 31 March, **Mustafa Bahr**, reporter and co-founder of Palestine Breaking News Website, was killed in an Israeli airstrike on Gaza City. 

On 28 March, editor and graphic designer **Mohammed Abu Sakhil,** who worked for Shams News Agency, was killed during Israel's military raid on Al-Shifa hospital and surrounding areas in Gaza City that lasted for two weeks, Shams News Agency [reported](https://shms.ps/post/188378/%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%B4%D9%87%D8%A7%D8%AF-%D9%85%D8%B3%D8%A4%D9%88%D9%84-%D9%82%D8%B3%D9%85-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D9%88%D9%86%D8%AA%D8%A7%D8%AC-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%A4%D8%B3%D8%B3%D8%A9-%D8%B4%D9%85%D8%B3-%D9%86%D9%8A%D9%88%D8%B2-%D9%85%D8%AD%D9%85%D8%AF-%D8%A3%D8%A8%D9%88-%D8%B3%D8%AE%D9%8A%D9%84-%D8%AE%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%84-%D9%85%D8%B0%D8%A8%D8%AD%D8%A9-%D9%85%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%B4%D9%81%D9%89-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B4%D9%81%D8%A7%D8%A1-%D8%BA%D8%B1%D8%A8-%D8%BA%D8%B2%D8%A9)
. Both lost their lives when an Israeli airstrike hit their home in Deir al-Balah, in the central Gaza Strip.

On 29 January, journalist **Mohamed Abdel El Fatah Atta Allah**, who worked as an editor for Al-Risala newspaper, was killed with members of his family in an Israeli bombardment that hit his house in Al Shati refugee camp in northern Gaza Strip, according to [PJS](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=423423826685490&set=a.211639694530572)
.

On the same day, **Tariq al-Maidna**, freelance camera operator for Yemen TV, was killed in Gaza, according to Skeyes Center for Media and Cultural Freedom.

On 26 January, journalist **Iyad Ahmed Al-Ruwahi**, who worked as a correspondent and presenter for Voice of Al Aqsa Radio, was killed together with members of his family when an Israeli airstrike hit his home in Al-Hasayna area of Al Nuseirat refugee camp, PJS [reported](https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=421371043557435&set=a.211639694530572&type=3&mibextid=WC7FNe)
. 

On 14 January, photographer **Yazan Al-Zuweidi**, who worked for Al-Ghad TV, was killed in an Israeli airstrike in the city of Beit Hanoun in northern Gaza, according to [PJS](https://www.alghad.tv/%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%B4%D9%87%D8%A7%D8%AF-%D9%8A%D8%B2%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B2%D9%88%D9%8A%D8%AF%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%B5%D9%88%D8%B1-%D9%82%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%BA%D8%AF-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D8%B4/)
 and [Al Ghad](https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=414525774241962&set=a.211639694530572)
. 

On 11 January, PJS [confirmed](https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=412679791093227&set=a.211639694530572)
 the death of **Mohammed Jamal Sabahi Al Thalathini**, who worked as a journalist for Al Quds TV, was killed in an Israeli airstrike that hit his home in the south of Gaza city.

On 10 January, journalist **Ahmad Bdeir**, who worked for local magazine Hadaf News, was killed as a result of an Israeli bombardment outside the Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in Deir al-Balah in the central Gaza Strip, [PJS](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=412297387798134&set=a.211639694530572)
 and [media](https://www.newarab.com/news/journalist-killed-israeli-massacre-outside-gaza-hospital)
 reported.

On the same day, freelance photographer **Shareef Okasha**, was kileld when an Israeli airstrike hit a house near the one is family was occupying after being displaces to Deir al Balah in central Gaza. 

On 9 January, PJS [confirmed](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=412133871147819&set=a.211639694530572)
 the killing of journalist **Heba Al-Abdallah**, who lost her life when an Israeli bombing hit her home in the southern city of Khan Yunis, [media](https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/war-gaza-israeli-army-kills-journalist-heba-al-abdallah-entire-family)
 reported.

On 7 January, journalist **Hamza Al-Dahdouh**, the son of Al Jazeera's Gaza bureau chief, Wael Al-Dahdouh, was killed together with journalist **Mustafa Thuraya**, when an Israel drone hit the car they where travelling [on assignment](https://network.aljazeera.net/en/press-releases/al-jazeera-condemns-assassination-hamza-aldahdooh-al-jazeera-correspondent-wael#:~:text=The%20assassination%20of%20Mustafa%20and,that%20there%20is%20no%20impunity.)
 near Rafah, several [local](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/1/7/hamza-son-of-al-jazeeras-wael-dahdouh-killed-in-israeli-attack-in-gaza)
 and [international](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/01/07/world/middleeast/journalists-gaza-al-jazeera-reporter-son.html)
 media and [PJS](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=410487724645767&set=a.211639694530572)
 reported. In the same attack, Al Jazeera bureau chief in Gaza, Wael Al-Dahdouh, [was wounded](https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/status/1735648242577363065)
. 

On 13 December, PJS [confirmed](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=396244306070109&set=a.211639694530572)
 the killing of journalist and former Al-Mayadeen correspondent **Abdul Karim Odeh,** who lost his life in an Israeli airstrike on the Nuseriat refugee camp in the Gaza Strip, media [reported](https://english.almayadeen.net/latestnews/2023/12/13/al-mayadeen-s-correspondent--fellow-journalist-abdul-karim-o)
.

On 11 December, PJS [confirmed](https://www.telesurenglish.net/news/Israel-Has-Killed-89-Journalists-During-Attacks-on-Gaza-20231213-0009.html)
 the death of **Narmeen Qawwas**, an intern at Russia Today (RT), killed in an Israeli airstrike that hit the family home in Gaza. 

On 9 December, journalist **Ala Atallah** was killed together with nine members of her family in an Israeli airstrike on the Al-Daraj neighbourhood in Gaza City, [PJS](https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=394525876241952&set=a.211639694530572)
 and [Roya News](https://en.royanews.tv/news/47325/Journalist%20'Ola%20Atallah'%20killed%20alongside%20family%20by%20'Israeli%20airstrike')
 reported. Before her killing, she [posted](https://www.facebook.com/PALESTINIANJOURNALISTSSYNDICATE/videos/728939165275082)
 a video from her home on social media documenting the ongoing situation in Gaza. 

On the same day, journalist **Khamis Salem Deab**, editor at Al Quds radio, was killed in an Israeli airstrike that hit his home in Gaza, PJS reported.

On 19 November, **Bilal Jadallah**, who was the director general of media development organisation Press House in Gaza, was killed in his car in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza, according to [PJS](https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=384256773935529&set=a.211639694530572)
 and [media](https://alqaheranews.net/news/54545/%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%B4%D9%87%D8%A7%D8%AF-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D8%AD%D9%81%D9%8A-%D8%A8%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%84-%D8%AC%D8%A7%D8%AF-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%84%D9%87-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D9%82%D8%B5%D9%81-%D8%A5%D8%B3%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%A6%D9%8A%D9%84%D9%8A-%D8%B9%D9%84%D9%89-%D8%BA%D8%B2%D8%A9)
.

On 18 November, [PJS](https://www.pjs.ps/?p=2640)
 and the [media](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/middle-east/another-palestinian-journalist-killed-by-israeli-army-in-gaza/3058262)
 reported the deaths of several journalists and media workers in Gaza."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from the International Federation of Journalists (IFJ) lists numerous journalists killed in Gaza due to Israeli airstrikes and gunfire. The list includes Ibrahim Muhareb, a freelance photojournalist, who was killed due to Israeli gunfire and shelling in western Khan Yunis on August 18, 2024. The source also mentions the death of Ibrahim Muhareb. <image:32>

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:32> This image shows Palestinian baby Sham Imad Muhareb which did not lose her arm in an Israeli airstrike on the Shejaeya neighborhood, east of Gaza City, in April 2025."

## Actions
```
web_search("Sham Imad Muhareb Gaza airstrike")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
From [Source](https://www.avapress.com/en/article/326644/the-voice-will-not-be-silenced): 
Content: The search result from Afghan Voice Agency (AVA) - International Service, published on August 27, 2025, reports on an Israeli airstrike on Nasser Hospital in Khan Yunis that killed 4 journalists and cameramen. The article also mentions a list of 50 Palestinian journalists who were martyred during the Gaza war as of August 25, 2025, including Ibrahim Muhareb. <image:32>


## Elaboration
The evidence mentions an Israeli airstrike and a list of martyred journalists, including Ibrahim Muhareb. The image is included in the article. However, the evidence does not explicitly state that the baby in the image is Sham Imad Muhareb, nor does it confirm the details of the injury.

The evidence does not provide enough information to verify the claim. More information is needed to confirm the baby's identity and the circumstances of her injuries.


## Actions
```
web_search("Sham Imad Muhareb arm injury Gaza")
image_search("Sham Imad Muhareb Gaza")
```

* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:32> This image shows Palestinian baby Sham Imad Muhareb which did not lose her arm in an Israeli airstrike on the Shejaeya neighborhood, east of Gaza City, in April 2025."

## Actions
```
web_search("Sham Imad Muhareb Gaza airstrike")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
From [Source](https://www.avapress.com/en/article/326644/the-voice-will-not-be-silenced): 
Content: The search result from Afghan Voice Agency (AVA) - International Service, published on August 27, 2025, reports on an Israeli airstrike on Nasser Hospital in Khan Yunis that killed 4 journalists and cameramen. The article also mentions a list of 50 Palestinian journalists who were martyred during the Gaza war as of August 25, 2025, including Ibrahim Muhareb. <image:32>


## Elaboration
The evidence mentions an Israeli airstrike and a list of martyred journalists, including Ibrahim Muhareb. The image is included in the article. However, the evidence does not explicitly state that the baby in the image is Sham Imad Muhareb, nor does it confirm the details of the injury.

The evidence does not provide enough information to verify the claim. More information is needed to confirm the baby's identity and the circumstances of her injuries.


## Actions
```
web_search("Sham Imad Muhareb arm injury Gaza")
image_search("Sham Imad Muhareb Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The International Federation of Journalists ([https://www.ifj.org/es/actions/projects/africa/informa-formation-sur-les-phenomenes-migratoires-en-afrique-de-louest?tx_news_pi1%5Baction%5D=detail&tx_news_pi1%5Bcontroller%5D=News&tx_news_pi1%5Bnews%5D=21667&tx_news_pi1%5BoverwriteDemand%5D%5Bcategories%5D=47&cHash=7448603e6b0fa12844a83484b8707019](https://www.ifj.org/es/actions/projects/africa/informa-formation-sur-les-phenomenes-migratoires-en-afrique-de-louest?tx_news_pi1%5Baction%5D=detail&tx_news_pi1%5Bcontroller%5D=News&tx_news_pi1%5Bnews%5D=21667&tx_news_pi1%5BoverwriteDemand%5D%5Bcategories%5D=47&cHash=7448603e6b0fa12844a83484b8707019)) mentions Ibrahim Muhareb, a freelance photojournalist, who was killed due to Israeli gunfire and shelling. The image is included in the article. <image:32>

Quds News Network ([https://t.me/s/QudsNen?before=158681](https://t.me/s/QudsNen?before=158681)) reports that Sham Imad Muhareb sustained critical injuries in an Israeli bombing, resulting in the amputation of her right hand. <image:10450>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates conflicting information. One source states that Sham Imad Muhareb sustained critical injuries in an Israeli bombing, resulting in the amputation of her right hand. However, the image provided does not show a missing arm. The claim is therefore not entirely accurate.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

The image is included in articles about the conflict, but the claim's specific details about the baby's injuries are not fully supported by the available evidence.

The claim is partially inaccurate because the image does not show the baby having lost her arm, as the claim states. The evidence provides conflicting information about the baby's injuries. `false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:32> This image shows Palestinian baby Sham Imad Muhareb which did not lose her arm in an Israeli airstrike on the Shejaeya neighborhood, east of Gaza City, in April 2025."

The article also mentions a list of 50 Palestinian journalists who were martyred during the Gaza war as of August 25, 2025, including Ibrahim Muhareb. <image:32>


## Elaboration
The evidence mentions an Israeli airstrike and a list of martyred journalists, including Ibrahim Muhareb. The image is included in the article. However, the evidence does not explicitly state that the baby in the image is Sham Imad Muhareb, nor does it confirm the details of the injury.

The evidence does not provide enough information to verify the claim. More information is needed to confirm the baby's identity and the circumstances of her injuries.


## Actions
```
web_search("Sham Imad Muhareb arm injury Gaza")
image_search("Sham Imad Muhareb Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The International Federation of Journalists ([https://www.ifj.org/es/actions/projects/africa/informa-formation-sur-les-phenomenes-migratoires-en-afrique-de-louest?tx_news_pi1%5Baction%5D=detail&tx_news_pi1%5Bcontroller%5D=News&tx_news_pi1%5Bnews%5D=21667&tx_news_pi1%5BoverwriteDemand%5D%5Bcategories%5D=47&cHash=7448603e6b0fa12844a83484b8707019](https://www.ifj.org/es/actions/projects/africa/informa-formation-sur-les-phenomenes-migratoires-en-afrique-de-louest?tx_news_pi1%5Baction%5D=detail&tx_news_pi1%5Bcontroller%5D=News&tx_news_pi1%5Bnews%5D=21667&tx_news_pi1%5BoverwriteDemand%5D%5Bcategories%5D=47&cHash=7448603e6b0fa12844a83484b8707019)) mentions Ibrahim Muhareb, a freelance photojournalist, who was killed due to Israeli gunfire and shelling. The image is included in the article. <image:32>

Quds News Network ([https://t.me/s/QudsNen?before=158681](https://t.me/s/QudsNen?before=158681)) reports that Sham Imad Muhareb sustained critical injuries in an Israeli bombing, resulting in the amputation of her right hand. <image:10450>


## Elaboration
The evidence indicates conflicting information. One source states that Sham Imad Muhareb sustained critical injuries in an Israeli bombing, resulting in the amputation of her right hand. However, the image provided does not show a missing arm. The claim is therefore not entirely accurate.


## Final Judgement
The evidence reveals conflicting information. While one source states that Sham Imad Muhareb lost her right hand in an Israeli bombing, the image provided does not depict this injury. The image is included in articles about the conflict, but the claim's specific details about the baby's injuries are not fully supported by the available evidence.

The claim is partially inaccurate because the image does not show the baby having lost her arm, as the claim states. The evidence provides conflicting information about the baby's injuries. `false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is **false**. While the image is associated with Sham Imad Muhareb and the Gaza conflict, the evidence, including a report from Quds News Network, indicates that she lost her right hand in an Israeli bombing, which is not visible in the image.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

## Claim

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/6/israel-launches-ground-offensive-on-jabalia-again-killing-17): 
Content: "![A Palestinian man wounded in an Israeli strike reacts as he sits on the floor at a hospital, amid the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas, in Jabalia,](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/2024-10-06T092503Z_362702973_RC2IEAAC7K44_RTRMADP_3_ISRAEL-PALESTINIANS-GAZA-1728224816.jpg?resize=770%2C513&quality=80)

A Palestinian man wounded in an Israeli strike reacts as he sits on the floor at a hospital, in Jabalia, in the northern Gaza Strip on October 5, 2024 \[File: Hussam Al-Zaanin/Reuters\]

Published On 6 Oct 20246 Oct 2024

The Israeli military has carried out intense bombardment in the Jabalia refugee camp, killing at least 17 people hours after forcing residents in the area to leave again during its third ground assault on the densely populated camp in northern Gaza since launching the war a year ago.

The Palestinian Civil Defence agency said [on Sunday](/news/liveblog/2024/10/6/live-israel-carries-out-very-violent-bombing-campaign-on-beirut)
 that the death toll included nine children following air attacks and as the army deployed tanks into the area for the first time in months.

Recommended Stories
-------------------

list of 3 items

list 1 of 3

### [One Year in Gaza: Nowhere Safe](/video/witness/2024/10/5/one-year-in-gaza-nowhere-safe)

list 2 of 3

### [Palestinians killed in Israeli attack on mosque in Gaza’s Deir el-Balah](/video/newsfeed/2024/10/6/palestinians-killed-in-israeli-attack-on-mosque-in-gazas-deir-el-balah)

list 3 of 3

### [Photos: Israeli strikes on Gaza mosque, school kill 26 Palestinians](/gallery/2024/10/6/deadly-israeli-strike-on-gaza-mosque-turned-shelter)

end of list

The Palestinian Civil Defence spokesperson in Gaza, Mahmoud Basal, added that Jabalia was targeted with multiple strikes overnight, resulting in many casualties. It felt like the early days of the war,” Raed, 52, from Jabalia, told the Reuters news agency before his family left for Gaza City on Sunday.

On Sunday morning, the Israeli military said its forces had “successfully” encircled the refugee camp and were operating in the area.

The army said the decision was taken after intelligence indicated the “presence of terrorists and terror infrastructure in the area of Jabalia … as well as efforts by Hamas to rebuild its operational capabilities in the area”.

Israel has destroyed hospitals, schools and residential areas, claiming Hamas was operating under them but providing no proof of its claims. Rights organisations say these attacks amount to war crimes.

Meanwhile, the armed wing of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad has said its fighters have targeted “a command and control room” belonging to Israeli forces who were trying to get into Jabalia refugee camp.

‘Deteriorating’ situation
-------------------------

Reporting from near the Kamal Adwan Hospital in Jabalia, journalist Moath al-Kahlout said that the situation in the north was “deteriorating”, adding that an “entire family” had been killed in the overnight attacks.

“The Israeli army dropped leaflets on the Jabalia refugee camp ordering people to flee their homes, and this alarming development suggests that the Israeli army is preparing for further attacks. This may lead to more civilian deaths and injuries,” he said.

Military and security analyst Elijah Magnier says Israel’s renewed ground invasion of northern Gaza was “inevitable” as far-right Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich claimed that Palestinian armed resistance groups had recruited “more than a thousand people”.

“Israelis have returned to Gaza several times, they’ve returned to the north several times, they’ve destroyed the infrastructure, the hospitals, everything,” Magnier told Al Jazeera.

“They will continue doing so unless \[Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin\] Netanyahu stops this war.”

![INTERACTIVE-Israeli -evacuation order-north gaza- October 6, 2024-1728203089](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/INTERACTIVE-Israeli-evacuation-order-north-gaza-October-6-2024-1728203089.png?w=770&resize=770%2C962&quality=80)

(Al Jazeera)

Evacuation orders
-----------------

The Israeli army has called on Palestinians in northern Gaza to flee to designated “safe zones” in southern and central Gaza as it begins a renewed ground offensive. Residents in Jabalia have described the intensified attacks as some of the worst in months.

“Dozens of explosions from air strikes and tank shelling shook the ground and buildings. But no place in Gaza is safe for Palestinians, including the so-called “safe zones”, campaigners say.

But as some Palestinians begin making the journey southwards, Gaza’s Interior Ministry has called on residents to ignore Israel’s evacuation orders.

“Israeli claims about the presence of safe zones in southern Gaza are lies as Israel commits crimes and massacres in all areas of the enclave,” the ministry said in a statement.

“We call on citizens in northern Gaza to ignore Israeli threats.”

Reporting from Deir el-Balah in central Gaza, Al Jazeera’s Hind Khoudary said the difference this time, compared to earlier evacuation orders, is that it is “not only blocks but whole areas”.

“Some of those Palestinians who were in the north have refused to evacuate despite the attacks and also the starvation and harsh conditions the blockade has imposed on them. They still refuse to leave,” Khoudary said.

She added that a member of the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA) was also targeted in Sunday’s strikes and was killed.

According to Gaza’s Health Ministry, at least 41,870 Palestinians have been killed and 97,166 others injured since the war began on October 7.

Source: Al Jazeera and news agencies

aj-logo"

The article mentions intense bombardment, tank deployment, and casualties, including children. <image:1> shows a Palestinian man wounded in an Israeli strike in Jabalia. The article also mentions evacuation orders from the Israeli army and the Palestinian Interior Ministry's call to ignore them.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2024/dec/18/jabaliya-refugee-camp-gaza-destruction-idf): 
Content: "As well as the large open market at its centre, there were restaurants and schools, two football teams, bakeries and clinics.

[Satellite map of Jabaliya on 8 Oct 2023](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabaliya_8_oct_2023_tue_final/giv-4559YJ4SlWz5oDm0)

This footage from 2022 shows people on a packed street in the camp’s main market during Eid al-Fitr celebrations.

[This footage from 2022 shows people on a packed street in the camp’s main market during Eid al-Fitr celebrations.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops1.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops1.mp4)

Between 10.30am and 11.30am on 9 October last year, five Israeli airstrikes tore through the market, killing dozens of people.

[Aftermath of an airstrike in al-Trans area on 9 October 2023](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops2.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops2.mp4)

They were the opening salvoes of a devastating Israeli campaign, conducted in three waves, that has left the camp an unrecognisable wasteland of rubble.

“This year is one of the worst I have experienced,” said 33-year-old Ahlam al-Tlouli, who comes from the Tal al-Zaatar area of the camp. The deadliest, on 31 October, [killed scores of people](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/01/jabalia-camp-airstrike-gaza)
 and left large craters in the ground at a busy junction.

[Large craters left in ground after Jabaliya was pummelled with airstrikes on 31 October 2023.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops3.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops3.mp4)

Israel said the camp was a command centre for Hamas’s northern brigade and that it had identified Hamas tunnel systems under the camp. “No house, person, tree or stone was spared.”

‘Jabaliya is like hell’
-----------------------

**The third offensive: October 2024 – ongoing**

The heavy damage inflicted on Jabaliya during the second offensive paled in comparison with the destruction levelled since 5 October, when Israeli forces returned in large numbers for a third time.

Over the course of the offensive – which targeted Jabaliya city as well as the camp – whole groupings of buildings have been demolished, replaced in some areas by bulldozed lanes to accommodate Israeli armour and tank berms. In late January, Israel withdrew from the camp.

‘All the houses were in ruins’
------------------------------

**The second offensive: May 2024**

Intermittent clashes continued throughout January despite Israeli claims that Hamas had been defeated in Jabaliya. This footage from April shows damage to buildings along two roads in the camp.

[Damaged buildings in Jabaliya refugee camp.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops4.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops4.mp4)

On 11 May the IDF reported that Hamas had managed to reconstitute its military capabilities, and it issued a new round of evacuation orders to civilians. In footage posted online in recent weeks, bulldozers and backhoes can be seen pulling down structures.

[Backhoe used to pull down building in October 2024.](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/embed/from-tool/looping-video/index.html?poster-image=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops6.jpg&mp4-video=https%3A%2F%2Fuploads.guim.co.uk%2F2024%2F11%2F29%2F28_Nov_Jabalia_Loops6.mp4)

Some neighbourhoods have almost entirely disappeared, including block 4, which included the camp’s main school complex.

[Satellite image of Block 4 in Jabaliya refugee camp](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabaliya_block4_sidebyside_tue_final/giv-45591oPngPow70Km/)

“There are bodies on the roads and under the rubble,” said Mahmoud Basal, 39, a civil defence official. It has an awful momentum.”

Other observers detect a more deliberate agenda in Jabaliya and across northern Gaza: the slow enactment of a scorched earth policy known as the “generals’ plan”, aimed at driving out civilians from areas by declaring them “closed military zones” where anyone who stays is considered a combatant and all aid and other supplies are cut.

Regardless of the intention, whole-scale destruction of neighbourhoods has taken place across the north of Gaza, including in the camp.

[Satellite image of Jabaliya refugee camp from 12 Nov 2024](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabaliya_12-nov-2023_tue_final/giv-4559UcmYNSAvUq79)

A document circulated to Israeli combat soldiers in recent weeks, [revealed by the Israeli newspaper Haaretz](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/security-aviation/2024-11-13/ty-article-magazine/.premium/idf-gearing-up-to-remain-in-gaza-until-end-of-2025-at-least-this-is-what-it-looks-like/00000193-2230-d76d-a7db-637196a00000)
, talks of “exposing large areas” – a euphemism, the paper says, for destroying buildings and infrastructure in such a way that Hamas fighters cannot hide in them but no one can live in them either.

Nadia Hardman, a researcher at Human Rights Watch, said HRW had identified a pattern in Jabaliya and across the north of Israeli forces clearing territory for buffer zones and security corridors.

“People can argue whether the campaign of bombing is reckless destruction or part of the hostilities, but taking control of an area and intentionally destroying it looks far more systematic,” Hardman said.

In a statement, the IDF said: “The IDF is currently operating in northern Gaza against terrorist targets due to Hamas’s efforts to restore its operational capabilities in the area … The IDF targets only military objectives. “Homes, streets, health and educational facilities – everything is gone.”

----------- Two days into the Gaza war triggered by Hamas’s surprise attack in [Israel](https://www.theguardian.com/world/israel)
, it had yet to be hit by Israeli jets.

The camp, just north of the city of the same name, was established in 1948. Every minute that passes feels like a year.”

Over the course of the Israeli invasion, settlements across the Gaza Strip have suffered damage.

[Map showing damage to settlements](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/12/jabailya_locator_update/giv-45592lvKwJoM9WfY/)

This is the story of the ruin of Jabaliya.

‘We were starving and without food’
-----------------------------------

**The first offensive: October 2023 – January** **2024**

Jabaliya was pummelled with airstrikes in the first months of the war."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Guardian published an article on December 18, 2024, discussing the destruction of the Jabaliya refugee camp in Gaza by Israeli forces. The article mentions three offensives, with the third one ongoing since October 5, 2024. The article includes satellite images and videos showing the destruction of buildings and infrastructure in the camp. <image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>, <image:4>, <image:5>, <image:6>. The article also mentions that the IDF said it targets only military objectives.

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

## Claim

Rajab](/wiki/Killing_of_Hind_Rajab "Killing of Hind Rajab")<br>    <br>*   [Tel al-Sultan](/wiki/Tel_al-Sultan_attack "Tel al-Sultan attack")<br>    <br>*   [al-Mawasi [Nuseirat](/wiki/Nuseirat_rescue_and_massacre "Nuseirat rescue and massacre")<br>    <br>*   [al-Mawasi (June)](/wiki/June_2024_Al-Mawasi_refugee_camp_attack "June 2024 Al-Mawasi refugee camp attack")<br>    <br>*   [al-Shati and Tuffah](/wiki/June_2024_northern_Gaza_City_airstrikes "June 2024 northern Gaza City airstrikes")<br>    <br>*   [al-Awda school](/wiki/Al-Awda_school_attack "Al-Awda school attack")<br>    <br>*   [al-Mawasi (July)](/wiki/13_July_2024_al-Mawasi_attack "13 July 2024 al-Mawasi attack")<br>    <br>*   [al-Shati attack")<br>    <br>*   [Khadija school](/wiki/Khadija_School_airstrike "Khadija School airstrike")<br>    <br>*   [Hamama school](/wiki/Hamama_School_bombing "Hamama School bombing")<br>    <br>*   [al-Tabaeen school](/wiki/Al-Tabaeen_school_attack "Al-Tabaeen school attack")<br>    <br>*   [Deir al-Balah](/wiki/August_2024_Deir_al-Balah_attacks "August 2024 Deir al-Balah attacks")<br>    <br>*   [al-Mawasi (September)](/wiki/September_2024_Al-Mawasi_refugee_camp_attack "September 2024 Al-Mawasi refugee camp attack")<br>    <br>*   [al-Jawni school](/wiki/September_2024_Al-Jawni_School_attack "September 2024 Al-Jawni School attack")<br>    <br>*   [Deir al-Balah mosque](/wiki/October_2024_Deir_al-Balah_mosque_bombing "October 2024 Deir al-Balah mosque bombing")<br>    <br>*   [Rufaida school](/wiki/October_2024_Rufaida_school_attack "October 2024 Rufaida school attack")<br>    <br>*   [al-Aqsa hospital](/wiki/14_October_2024_Al-Aqsa_Hospital_attack "14 October 2024 Al-Aqsa Hospital attack")<br>     ([Killing of Shaban al-Dalou](/wiki/Killing_of_Shaban_al-Dalou "Killing of Shaban al-Dalou")<br>    )<br>*   [Abu Hussein school](/wiki/October_2024_Abu_Hussein_school_attack "October 2024 Abu Hussein school attack")<br>    <br>*   [Beit Lahia (19 October)](/wiki/19_October_2024_Beit_Lahia_attacks "19 October 2024 Beit Lahia attacks")<br>    <br>*   [Beit Lahia (29 October)](/wiki/29_October_2024_Beit_Lahia_airstrike "29 October 2024 Beit Lahia airstrike")<br>    <br>*   [Kerem Shalom aid convoy looting](/wiki/Kerem_Shalom_aid_convoy_looting "Kerem Shalom aid convoy looting")<br>    <br>*   [al-Mawasi (December)](/wiki/4_December_2024_al-Mawasi_attack "4 December 2024 al-Mawasi attack")<br>    <br>*   [Nuseirat (December)](/wiki/December_2024_Nuseirat_refugee_camp_attack "December 2024 Nuseirat refugee camp attack")<br>    <br>*   [March 2025 Israeli strikes](/wiki/March_2025_Israeli_attacks_on_the_Gaza_Strip "March 2025 Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip")<br>    <br>*   [Rafah paramedic massacre](/wiki/Rafah_paramedic_massacre "Rafah paramedic massacre")<br>    <br>*   [April 2025 Shuja'iyya](/wiki/April_2025_Shuja%27iyya_airstrike "April 2025 Shuja'iyya airstrike")<br>    <br>*   [Gaza European Hospital](/wiki/2025_Gaza_European_Hospital_strikes "2025 Gaza European Hospital strikes")<br>    <br>*   [Killing of al-Najjar children](/wiki/Killing_of_al-Najjar_children "Killing of al-Najjar children")<br>    <br>*   [Fahmi al-Jarjawi school](/wiki/Fahmi_al-Jarjawi_School_Massacre "Fahmi al-Jarjawi School Massacre")<br>    <br>*   [2025 Gaza Strip aid distribution killings](/wiki/2025_Gaza_Strip_aid_distribution_killings "2025 Gaza Strip aid distribution killings")<br>    <br>*   [Al-Baqa Cafe](/wiki/Al-Baqa_Cafe_airstrike "Al-Baqa Cafe airstrike")<br>    <br><br>* * *<br><br>[War crimes and effects](/wiki/War_crimes_in_the_Gaza_war "War crimes in the Gaza war")<br><br>*   [War crimes and crimes against humanity report](/wiki/Diplomatic_impact_of_the_Gaza_war#Independent_International_Commission_of_Inquiry_on_the_Occupied_Palestinian_Territory_report "Diplomatic impact of the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Palestinian war crimes](/wiki/Palestinian_war_crimes "Palestinian war crimes")<br>    *   [Hostage crisis](/wiki/Gaza_war_hostage_crisis "Gaza war hostage crisis")<br>        *   [2023 prisoner exchange](/wiki/2023_Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_prisoner_exchange "2023 Israeli–Palestinian prisoner exchange")<br>            <br>*   [Israeli war crimes](/wiki/Israeli_war_crimes_in_the_Gaza_war "Israeli war crimes in the Gaza war")<br>    *   [Israeli blockade of Gaza](/wiki/Israeli_blockade_of_the_Gaza_Strip_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Israeli blockade of the Gaza Strip (2023–present)")<br>        *   [Famine](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_famine "Gaza Strip famine")<br>            <br>    *   [AI-assisted targeting](/wiki/AI-assisted_targeting_in_the_Gaza_Strip "AI-assisted targeting in the Gaza Strip")<br>        <br>    *   [Mass detentions](/wiki/Mass_detentions_in_the_Gaza_war "Mass detentions in the Gaza war")<br>        <br>    *   [South Africa v. It began on 5 October 2024 when the [Israel Defense Forces](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")
 (IDF) reinvaded [Jabalia](/wiki/Jabalia "Jabalia")
 and [its refugee camp](/wiki/Jabalia_refugee_camp "Jabalia refugee camp")
 for the first time in months since [earlier fighting](/wiki/Battle_of_Jabalia "Battle of Jabalia")
.[\[18\]](#cite_note-18)
[\[9\]](#cite_note-bbc.com-9)

The siege was reportedly part of Israel's "[generals' plan](/wiki/Israeli_generals%27_plan "Israeli generals' plan")
" to force Palestinians out of northern Gaza by designating it a combat zone and issuing [evacuation orders](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_evacuations "Gaza Strip evacuations")
 to civilians under threat of death.[\[19\]](#cite_note-:4-19)
 The IDF imposed a complete siege on northern Gaza, cutting it off from [Gaza City](/wiki/Gaza_City "Gaza City")
 by destroying most of the roads leading south and preventing the [entry of aid](/wiki/Humanitarian_aid_during_the_Gaza_war "Humanitarian aid during the Gaza war")
.[\[20\]](#cite_note-Stray_dogs-20)
[\[21\]](#cite_note-21)
 Evacuations were hindered, however, by [Israeli bombardments](/wiki/Israeli_bombing_of_the_Gaza_Strip "Israeli bombing of the Gaza Strip")
 and [shootings of fleeing civilians](/wiki/Attacks_on_protected_zones_and_civilians_in_Gaza "Attacks on protected zones and civilians in Gaza")
, leaving many trapped.[\[22\]](#cite_note-Thousands_trapped_in_Jabalia_camp-22)
 Human rights groups raised concerns of [war crimes](/wiki/Israeli_war_crimes_in_the_Gaza_war "Israeli war crimes in the Gaza war")
, and Israeli actions were characterized as ethnic cleansing and [genocide](/wiki/Gaza_genocide "Gaza genocide")
.[\[23\]](#cite_note-Dead_bodies_everywhere-23)
[\[24\]](#cite_note-24)
 Israel [attacked hospitals](/wiki/Attacks_on_health_facilities_during_the_Gaza_war "Attacks on health facilities during the Gaza war")
 and [medical infrastructure](/wiki/Attacks_on_health_facilities_during_the_Gaza_war "Attacks on health facilities during the Gaza war")
, as international bodies warned of disastrous conditions in Jabalia.[\[25\]](#cite_note-Last_remaining_hospitals_in_North_Gaza-25)

Israel's siege extended to Beit Lahia and Beit Hanoun, with officials stating no food had been allowed to enter either town or Jabalia.[\[26\]](#cite_note-26)
 A senior [COGAT](/wiki/Coordinator_of_Government_Activities_in_the_Territories "Coordinator of Government Activities in the Territories")
 official stated that aid delivery was being confined to Gaza City because there was "no population" remaining in Beit Lahia and Beit Hanoun.[\[27\]](#cite_note-27)

A [ceasefire](/wiki/2025_Gaza_war_ceasefire "2025 Gaza war ceasefire")
 between Israel and Hamas came into effect on 19 January 2025, with the IDF withdrawing from northern Gaza to a buffer zone along the [Gaza Strip–Israel border](/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_barrier "Gaza–Israel barrier")
 on that same day.[\[28\]](#cite_note-:5-28)

Background
----------

Further information: [Battle of Beit Hanoun](/wiki/Battle_of_Beit_Hanoun "Battle of Beit Hanoun")
 and [Battle of Jabalia](/wiki/Battle_of_Jabalia "Battle of Jabalia")

Fighting between Palestinian militants and the IDF had taken place in [Beit Hanoun](/wiki/Beit_Hanoun "Beit Hanoun")
 and Jabalia since 27 October 2023 and 8 November 2023, respectively.[\[29\]](#cite_note-29)
[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 The IDF also launched raids into [Beit Lahia](/wiki/Beit_Lahia "Beit Lahia")
 such as the [Kamal Adwan Hospital sieges](/wiki/Kamal_Adwan_Hospital_sieges "Kamal Adwan Hospital sieges")
 in December 2024 and May 2024.[\[30\]](#cite_note-30)
[\[31\]](#cite_note-31)
[\[32\]](#cite_note-32)

The IDF encountered "significant resistance" during the [fighting in Jabalia](/wiki/Battle_of_Jabalia "Battle of Jabalia")
[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 and ultimately failed to dismantle Hamas' presence in the city.[\[33\]](#cite_note-:6-33)

On 31 May 2024, the IDF withdrew from North Gaza, including both Beit Hanoun and Jabalia.[\[34\]](#cite_note-34)
[\[35\]](#cite_note-35)

In the four months since the Israeli withdrawal, Hamas reportedly reconstituted itself in Jabalia and managed to recruit thousands of new fighters in the area.[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 Hamas also planted explosives in almost all buildings in Jabalia, sometimes even causing the death of its own militants.[\[36\]](#cite_note-36)

Siege
-----

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e2/Merkava_of_Beit_Hanoun.jpg/250px-Merkava_of_Beit_Hanoun.jpg)](/wiki/File:Merkava_of_Beit_Hanoun.jpg)

Israeli soldiers inspecting a [Merkava](/wiki/Merkava "Merkava")
 that was destroyed by Hamas in [Beit Hanoun](/wiki/Beit_Hanoun "Beit Hanoun")

### Jabalia

On the evening of 5 October,[\[4\]](#cite_note-:dateclarification1-4)
[\[5\]](#cite_note-:dateclarification2-5)
 the IDF began its stated operation to dismantle Hamas control in Jabalia, with the [Israeli Air Force](/wiki/Israeli_Air_Force "Israeli Air Force")
 launching strikes around the area while armored brigades encircled the [Jabalia refugee camp](/wiki/Jabalia_refugee_camp "Jabalia refugee camp")
.[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)

The IDF advanced into Jabalia and were met by combined attacks from Hamas, [Palestinian Islamic Jihad](/wiki/Palestinian_Islamic_Jihad "Palestinian Islamic Jihad")
 (PIJ), [al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades](/wiki/Al-Aqsa_Martyrs%27_Brigades "Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades")
, and the [Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine](/wiki/Popular_Front_for_the_Liberation_of_Palestine "Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine")
 (PFLP).[\[6\]](#cite_note-:0-6)
 PIJ launched an attack on an Israeli [command and control room](/wiki/Command_center "Command center")
 belonging to forces attempting to penetrate the Jabalia refugee camp.[\[37\]](#cite_note-:1-37)

On 10 October, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.[\[38\]](#cite_note-:2-38)
[\[39\]](#cite_note-39)
[\[40\]](#cite_note-40)
 The IDF said that an Israeli airstrike on a Hamas command and control centre killed at least 12 Hamas and PIJ commanders.[\[38\]](#cite_note-:2-38)

On 13 October, Israeli prime minister [Benjamin Netanyahu](/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu "Benjamin Netanyahu")
 stated that the IDF had reached "the heart of Jabalia" and were dismantling Hamas strongholds there. He is considered to have been the highest-ranking officer to have died in ground combat since the start of the Gaza war.[\[45\]](#cite_note-45)
[\[46\]](#cite_note-46)

On 22 October, Hamas said that its fighters detonated an explosive device targeting 12 Israeli soldiers in the Jabalia refugee camp, killing and wounding some of them.[\[47\]](#cite_note-47)

On 17 November, Israeli media reported that that IDF soldiers preparing an ambush in southern Jabalia were themselves ambushed by Hamas fighters.[\[48\]](#cite_note-48)

On 20 December, a Hamas fighter carried out a suicide bombing against an IDF position in the Jabalia camp.[\[49\]](#cite_note-49)

On 30 December, Palestinian militants carried out a "relatively large attack" in multiple waves against IDF positions around the Jabalia camp.[\[50\]](#cite_note-50)

### Beit Lahia

On 11 October, clashes between the IDF and Hamas were reported to be taking place in Beit Lahia.[\[51\]](#cite_note-51)
 Palestinian health officials stated on 27 October that Israeli strikes had killed at least 87 people.[\[52\]](#cite_note-52)
 On 28 October, an Israeli attack on the Beit Lahia residential square reportedly killed 45 people, with more than 30 trapped under the rubble.[\[53\]](#cite_note-53)
 After residents of Jabalia fled to Beit Lahia, the IDF then reportedly turned their attention to the town.[\[54\]](#cite_note-54)
 Sam Rose, a UN official, stated, "People who fled to Beit Lahiya have themselves been bombed".[\[55\]](#cite_note-55)
 Beit Lahia declared a state of emergency due to Israel's siege and attacks, stating, "We declare that the city is a disaster area due to the Israeli war of extermination and siege, and it has no food, water, hospitals, doctors, services, or communications".[\[56\]](#cite_note-56)

Five people were reportedly killed by Israeli airstrikes in Beit Lahia on 1 November.[\[57\]](#cite_note-57)
 Rescue teams were also attacked, with three members hit by a drone, while the civil defence stated an Israeli tank destroyed their only fire truck.[\[58\]](#cite_note-58)
 At least twenty people were reportedly killed during an attack on 4 November, with video showing residents pulling bodies out of the rubble.[\[59\]](#cite_note-59)

On 23 December, Hamas said that some of its fighters stormed an IDF position at a building in Beit Lahia and managed to free several Palestinians who had been detained inside.[\[60\]](#cite_note-60)

### Beit Hanoun

In Beit Hanoun, the IDF conducted bombings on the night of 11–12 November and targeted fleeing civilians with drones and sniper fire the next day.[\[61\]](#cite_note-61)
 The IDF besieged some 130 families in a shelter in the city and forced them to leave at gunpoint.[\[62\]](#cite_note-62)

Despite claiming to have “dismantled Hamas” in Beit Hanoun, Israeli forces who entered the abandoned city on 23 December were immediately ambushed by militants. We can’t get out."[\[80\]](#cite_note-80)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c0/NetzarimCorridor.jpg/330px-NetzarimCorridor.jpg)](/wiki/File:NetzarimCorridor.jpg)

Approximate location of the [Netzarim Corridor](/wiki/Netzarim_Corridor "Netzarim Corridor")
.

According to Israeli media, tens of thousands of Palestinians have passed through the IDF security crossing at the [Netzarim Corridor](/wiki/Netzarim_Corridor "Netzarim Corridor")
 to get to the southern Gaza Strip.[\[41\]](#cite_note-:3-41)
 On 7 October 2024, however, UN Spokesperson [Stéphane Dujarric](/wiki/St%C3%A9phane_Dujarric "Stéphane Dujarric")
 stated many people in northern Gaza were "trapped" in their homes and that "few families have crossed Wadi Gaza heading South".[\[81\]](#cite_note-81)
 [Doctors Without Borders](/wiki/Doctors_Without_Borders "Doctors Without Borders")
 stated at least five of their staff members were trapped in Jabalia, stating, "Nobody is allowed to get in or out; anyone who tries is getting shot".[\[22\]](#cite_note-Thousands_trapped_in_Jabalia_camp-22)
 [UNRWA](/wiki/UNRWA "UNRWA")
 head [Philippe Lazzarini](/wiki/Philippe_Lazzarini "Philippe Lazzarini")
 stated, "People attempting to flee are getting killed, their bodies left on the street".[\[82\]](#cite_note-82)

Anas al-Sharif, a journalist on the ground, stated that possibly thousands of families were "trapped between tanks, their gunfire, and heavy artillery shelling".[\[83\]](#cite_note-83)
 One woman stated she was forced from her home "at gunpoint" as tanks and heavily armed soldiers encircled her family, and that young men were separated for interrogation.[\[84\]](#cite_note-84)
 Another woman stated that in Jabalia, a quadcopter told residents: "Don't think of north Gaza ever again."[\[85\]](#cite_note-Under_deadly_Israeli_siege-85)
 Israeli footage showed men separated at checkpoints in northern Gaza and possibly detained.[\[86\]](#cite_note-86)
 The Israeli military released footage of Palestinians being rounded up near the besieged Indonesia Hospital, where they had been sheltering.[\[87\]](#cite_note-87)
[\[88\]](#cite_note-88)
 Residents stated Israeli forced stormed shelters for displaced families and detained men, with footage showing men sitting next to a tank while others were led away by a soldier.[\[89\]](#cite_note-89)
 The UN Human Rights Office stated it was concerned the men could be subject to arbitrary detainment and torture.[\[90\]](#cite_note-90)

### Targeting of civilians

Per the [Palestinian Civil Defense](/wiki/Palestinian_Civil_Defence "Palestinian Civil Defence")
, at least 17 people, including 9 children, were killed in the IDF's initial wave of airstrikes.[\[37\]](#cite_note-:1-37)
 One of those killed was journalist Hassan Hamad, who was reportedly deliberately targeted by Israel after receiving threats via messages and calls from Israeli officers, ordering him to stop his reporting.[\[91\]](#cite_note-91)
 After an Israeli airstrike on 11 October that killed at least 22 Palestinians and wounded more than 90, Hamas made a statement the following day condemning what it described as the "[Nazi](/wiki/Nazism "Nazism")
 occupation’s massacres" in Jabalia under [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States")
 protection.[\[92\]](#cite_note-92)
 Journalists stated they were being directly targeted by the Israeli army, including Fadi Al Wahidi, who was reportedly shot in the neck by a sniper.[\[93\]](#cite_note-93)

On 14 October, [Al Jazeera Arabic](/wiki/Al_Jazeera_Arabic "Al Jazeera Arabic")
 reported the Israeli military was planting explosives in homes to demolish them.[\[94\]](#cite_note-94)
 The same day, medics reported that Israeli forces fired on civilians waiting for flour at a food distribution centre, killing ten people and wounding dozens.[\[95\]](#cite_note-95)
 On 16 October, the Gaza Civil Defense stated there were dozens of people trapped under the rubble, and some bodies were laying in the road unable to be rescued.[\[96\]](#cite_note-96)
 Gaza's civil defence agency spokesman stated, "There are a number of pleas from families being bombed inside Jabalia camp... stated Israel had "failed to implement" their recommendations, and that it would "follow the law" if Israel did not comply by its deadline.[\[135\]](#cite_note-135)

### Hospitals and healthcare

During the siege, the Health Ministry stated Israel was "intensifying its targeting of the health system in the northern Gaza Strip".[\[103\]](#cite_note-Israeli_air_strike_kills_33-103)
 WHO's vaccination campaign to address Gaza's [polio epidemic](/wiki/2024_Gaza_Strip_polio_epidemic "2024 Gaza Strip polio epidemic")
 was delayed in northern Gaza due to the escalating violence and intense bombing.[\[136\]](#cite_note-136)
 On 9 October, an Israeli airstrike killed at least 15 people inside Al-Yemen Al-Saeed Hospital in Jabalia, which has housed displaced families.[\[137\]](#cite_note-137)
 Israel reportedly used a "double tap" bombing, injuring fifteen people in a family home, then targeted an ambulance arriving to help them, killing a doctor.[\[138\]](#cite_note-138)

The Gaza Health Ministry stated Israel had besieged and was directly targeting the [Indonesia Hospital](/wiki/Indonesia_Hospital "Indonesia Hospital")
, Kamal Adwan Hospital, and [Al-Awda Hospital](/wiki/Al-Awda_Hospital "Al-Awda Hospital")
.[\[139\]](#cite_note-139)
 More than 350 patients were reportedly trapped in the three hospitals, including pregnant women, people with chronic health conditions, and individuals needing surgeries.[\[25\]](#cite_note-Last_remaining_hospitals_in_North_Gaza-25)
 The Al Awda hospital stated Israeli strikes on the hospital and an ambulance had wounded several medical staff.[\[140\]](#cite_note-140)
 In a statement, the director of Al-Awda Hospital stated, "Israeli forces are targeting everything that moves in northern Gaza".[\[141\]](#cite_note-141)

#### Indonesia Hospital

The Indonesia Hospital's director stated, "Israeli tanks have completely surrounded the hospital, cut off electricity and shelled the hospital, targeting the second and third floors with artillery".[\[142\]](#cite_note-142)
 Staff reported heavy gunfire directed at the hospital, with more than 40 patients injured.[\[143\]](#cite_note-143)
 Two patients at Indonesia Hospital were reported to have died after the hospital lost electricity, as the UN stated the Indonesia Hospital was no longer operational.[\[144\]](#cite_note-144)
[\[145\]](#cite_note-145)
 Indonesia Hospital's chief nurse stated the hospital's water supply had been cut, that operating the electric generator required permission from the IDF, and there was no food available for four consecutive days.[\[146\]](#cite_note-146)
 On 21 October 2024, medics at Indonesia Hospital stated Israeli forces set a nearby school on fire, which spread to the hospital and shut down its power.[\[147\]](#cite_note-147)

#### Kamal Adwan Hospital

On 25 October 2024, Israel launched [a raid of Kamal Adwan Hospital](/wiki/Kamal_Adwan_Hospital_sieges#October_and_November_2024 "Kamal Adwan Hospital sieges")
.[\[148\]](#cite_note-148)
 The Palestinian health ministry stated 600 patients, companions, and staff were trapped.[\[149\]](#cite_note-149)
 The following day, the [World Health Organization](/wiki/World_Health_Organization "World Health Organization")
 stated that while the hospital was still under siege, it had regained contact with its employees there, stating that four employees were injured, 44 health workers had been detained, and four ambulances were damaged.[\[150\]](#cite_note-150)
 The Gaza Ministry of Health stated that Israeli forces had detained all male medical staff.[\[151\]](#cite_note-151)
 On 27 October, Dr. Israel](/wiki/South_Africa%27s_genocide_case_against_Israel "South Africa's genocide case against Israel")<br>        *   [Gaza genocide](/wiki/Gaza_genocide "Gaza genocide")<br>            <br>    *   [ICC arrest warrants](/wiki/International_Criminal_Court_arrest_warrants_for_Israeli_leaders "International Criminal Court arrest warrants for Israeli leaders")<br>        <br>*   [Gaza Strip mass graves](/wiki/Gaza_Strip_mass_graves "Gaza Strip mass graves")<br>    <br>*   [Torture](/wiki/Torture_during_the_Gaza_war "Torture during the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Executions and assassinations](/wiki/Executions_and_assassinations_during_the_Gaza_war "Executions and assassinations during the Gaza war")<br>    <br>*   [Killing of journalists](/wiki/Killing_of_journalists_in_the_Gaza_war "Killing of journalists in the Gaza war")<br>    *   [List of journalists](/wiki/List_of_journalists_killed_in_the_Gaza_war "List of Evacuation and attacks on civilians
-----------------------------------

### Generals' plan

Main article: [Israeli generals' plan](/wiki/Israeli_generals%27_plan "Israeli generals' plan")

On 6 October 2024, Israel designated all of the northern Gaza Strip as a combat zone and ordered the entire civilian population to evacuate.[\[71\]](#cite_note-71)
[\[72\]](#cite_note-72)
 Both Israeli military analysts and the [Al-Mezan Center for Human Rights](/wiki/Al-Mezan_Center_for_Human_Rights "Al-Mezan Center for Human Rights")
 alleged that this was the first stage of the "[generals' plan](/wiki/Israeli_generals%27_plan "Israeli generals' plan")
", a policy proposed by former Israeli general [Giora Eiland](/wiki/Giora_Eiland "Giora Eiland")
 to force Palestinians out of Gaza on pain of death.[\[73\]](#cite_note-73)
 The Israeli human rights organizations [Gisha](/wiki/Gisha_(human_rights_organization) "Gisha (human rights organization)")
, [B'Tselem](/wiki/B%27Tselem "B'Tselem")
, [Physicians for Human Rights](/wiki/Physicians_for_Human_Rights%E2%80%93Israel "Physicians for Human Rights–Israel")
 and [Yesh Din](/wiki/Yesh_Din "Yesh Din")
 stated there were "alarming signs" that Israel was implementing the plan.[\[74\]](#cite_note-74)
 Three Israeli reserve soldiers in Gaza stated it was their understanding the general's plan was being practically implemented.[\[75\]](#cite_note-75)
 The plan has been described by Hamas as [genocidal](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")
.[\[19\]](#cite_note-:4-19)
 Others have described the plan as the [ethnic cleansing](/wiki/Ethnic_cleansing "Ethnic cleansing")
 of northern Gaza.[\[23\]](#cite_note-Dead_bodies_everywhere-23)
 The United Nations warned that Israel was not allowing food to enter northern Gaza or Jabalia.[\[76\]](#cite_note-76)
[\[77\]](#cite_note-77)

On 7 October, the IDF issued evacuation orders for residents of Jabalia, Beit Hanoun, and Beit Lahia, instructing them to travel southwards to the [al-Mawasi humanitarian zone](/wiki/Al-Mawasi,_Rafah "Al-Mawasi, Rafah")
.[\[78\]](#cite_note-78)
 Following these evacuation orders was made more difficult by Israel's ongoing bombardment, as well as drones pursuing and shooting at individuals attempting to flee.[\[79\]](#cite_note-79)
 Residents reported being trapped in Jabalia, with all roads blocked except the main highway leading out. Then, they stormed the area with their tanks and opened fire randomly."[\[105\]](#cite_note-105)
 At least 87 people were killed by an [airstrike in Beit Lahia](/wiki/October_2024_Beit_Lahia_attacks "October 2024 Beit Lahia attacks")
.[\[106\]](#cite_note-106)

On 21 October, 10 people were reportedly killed and 30 wounded by an Israeli attack at the Jabalia Preparatory School turned shelter.[\[107\]](#cite_note-107)
 A paramedic fleeing the shelter stated that people were attempting to comply with an evacuation order when "suddenly there was shelling".[\[108\]](#cite_note-108)
[\[109\]](#cite_note-109)
 On 23 October, civil defence teams stated they were attempting to rescue people buried under rubble by hand.[\[110\]](#cite_note-110)
 The same day, three civil defense workers were wounded in a "targeted strike" by Israel, leading the agency to suspend operations in northern Gaza.[\[111\]](#cite_note-111)
 Israeli forces also reportedly killed northern Gaza's chief of police.[\[112\]](#cite_note-112)
 The civil defense reported 150 people were killed and injured in an airstrike on Jabalia's Block 7 on 24 October.[\[113\]](#cite_note-113)
 Dozens were killed by Israeli strikes on residences in Beit Lahia on 26 October.[\[114\]](#cite_note-114)
 As many as 93 people were killed by an [Israeli airstrike on Beit Lahia](/wiki/29_October_2024_Beit_Lahia_strike "29 October 2024 Beit Lahia strike")
 on 29 October.[\[115\]](#cite_note-115)

On 1 November 2024, the Gaza Government Media Office reported two Israeli airstrikes on residential buildings killed 84 people, including 50 children.[\[116\]](#cite_note-116)
 The civil defense stated they were unable to reach the site and residents were attempting rescues.[\[117\]](#cite_note-117)
 Women evacuating from Jabalia stated the Israeli army forced them into holes, where dust was thrown on them as an intimidation tactic.[\[118\]](#cite_note-118)

Dr. Retrieved 2025-01-22.

"

On 17 October, the Israeli air forced bombed the [Abu Hussein school](/wiki/October_2024_Abu_Hussein_school_attack "October 2024 Abu Hussein school attack")
."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the Siege of North Gaza, which took place from October 5, 2024, to January 19, 2025, as part of the Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip. The article mentions fighting in Jabalia, including an ambush on October 10, 2024, where Hamas destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company. The article also mentions the involvement of various groups, casualties, and the targeting of civilians and hospitals. The article states that on October 10, Hamas organized an ambush which destroyed an IDF mechanized infantry company of 12 vehicles east of the Jabalia camp.
